content: TITLE: Creating Private S3 Bucket with Versioning in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a private S3 bucket with versioning enabled. It configures object ownership control and sets the owner to ObjectWriter. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` module "s3_bucket" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws" bucket = "my-s3-bucket" acl = "private" control_object_ownership = true object_ownership = "ObjectWriter" versioning = { enabled = true } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating S3 Bucket with ALB/NLB Log Delivery Policy in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create an S3 bucket configured for ALB/NLB log delivery with the appropriate access policies. It attaches both ELB and LB log delivery policies to support all load balancer log types. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` module "s3_bucket_for_logs" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws" bucket = "my-s3-bucket-for-logs" # Allow deletion of non-empty bucket force_destroy = true control_object_ownership = true object_ownership = "ObjectWriter" attach_elb_log_delivery_policy = true # Required for ALB logs attach_lb_log_delivery_policy = true # Required for ALB/NLB logs } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating S3 Bucket with ELB Log Delivery Policy in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create an S3 bucket configured for ELB log delivery with the appropriate access policy. It enables force_destroy for allowing deletion of non-empty buckets and sets the ACL to log-delivery-write. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` module "s3_bucket_for_logs" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws" bucket = "my-s3-bucket-for-logs" acl = "log-delivery-write" # Allow deletion of non-empty bucket force_destroy = true control_object_ownership = true object_ownership = "ObjectWriter" attach_elb_log_delivery_policy = true } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Terraform Commands for S3 Bucket Configuration DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize, plan, and apply the Terraform configuration for creating S3 buckets with various features enabled. The module supports static website hosting, logging, versioning, CORS, lifecycle rules, encryption, and more. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/complete/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ terraform init $ terraform plan $ terraform apply ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: S3 Object Resource Configuration in Terraform DESCRIPTION: Resource configuration for AWS S3 bucket objects with comprehensive input variables including storage settings, encryption options, metadata management, and object lock configurations. Supports various storage classes, server-side encryption, and custom tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/modules/object/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` resource "aws_s3_object" "this" { # Configuration handled through variables bucket = var.bucket key = var.key acl = var.acl content = var.content content_base64 = var.content_base64 content_disposition = var.content_disposition content_encoding = var.content_encoding content_language = var.content_language content_type = var.content_type bucket_key_enabled = var.bucket_key_enabled cache_control = var.cache_control etag = var.etag force_destroy = var.force_destroy kms_key_id = var.kms_key_id metadata = var.metadata server_side_encryption = var.server_side_encryption storage_class = var.storage_class tags = var.tags website_redirect = var.website_redirect } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Terraform S3 Bucket Input Variables DESCRIPTION: Terraform input variables for configuring AWS S3 bucket properties including metrics, object locking, ownership controls, policies, encryption, and website hosting settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | metric_configuration | Map containing bucket metric configuration. | any | [] | no | | object_lock_configuration | Map containing S3 object locking configuration. | any | {} | no | | object_lock_enabled | Whether S3 bucket should have an Object Lock configuration enabled. | bool | false | no | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining S3 Bucket Input Variables in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure of input variables for an AWS S3 bucket module in Terraform. It includes variables for basic configuration, access control, logging, and various policy attachments. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` variable "acceleration_status" { description = "(Optional) Sets the accelerate configuration of an existing bucket. Can be Enabled or Suspended." type = string default = null } variable "acl" { description = "(Optional) The canned ACL to apply. Conflicts with `grant`" type = string default = null } variable "attach_policy" { description = "Controls if S3 bucket should have bucket policy attached (set to `true` to use value of `policy` as bucket policy)" type = bool default = false } variable "bucket" { description = "(Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name." type = string default = null } variable "force_destroy" { description = "(Optional, Default:false ) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the bucket so that the bucket can be destroyed without error. These objects are not recoverable." type = bool default = false } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Terraform Commands for S3 CRR Setup DESCRIPTION: Commands for initializing, planning, and applying the Terraform configuration to create S3 buckets with cross-region replication. Also includes a note about potential costs and how to destroy resources when not needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/s3-replication/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ terraform init $ terraform plan $ terraform apply ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Example of Terragrunt Configuration for Multiple S3 Buckets DESCRIPTION: This example shows a practical implementation of the wrapper pattern for managing multiple S3 buckets in a single Terragrunt layer. It defines common security policies as defaults and specifies two distinct buckets with their own configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { force_destroy = true attach_elb_log_delivery_policy = true attach_lb_log_delivery_policy = true attach_deny_insecure_transport_policy = true attach_require_latest_tls_policy = true } items = { bucket1 = { bucket = "my-random-bucket-1" } bucket2 = { bucket = "my-random-bucket-2" tags = { Secure = "probably" } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Conditional S3 Bucket Creation in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to conditionally create S3 resources using the create_bucket parameter. This is useful when you need to selectively create resources without using count inside module blocks. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` # This S3 bucket will not be created module "s3_bucket" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws" create_bucket = false # ... omitted } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing Terraform Commands for S3 Bucket Object Creation DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the sequence of Terraform commands to initialize, plan, and apply the S3 bucket object configurations. It also mentions the command to destroy resources when they are no longer needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/object/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ terraform init $ terraform plan $ terraform apply ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Multiple S3 Buckets in One Terragrunt Layer DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to manage multiple S3 buckets in a single Terragrunt layer using the module wrapper. It sets default values for all buckets and defines specific configurations for individual buckets. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/account-public-access/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { force_destroy = true attach_elb_log_delivery_policy = true attach_lb_log_delivery_policy = true attach_deny_insecure_transport_policy = true attach_require_latest_tls_policy = true } items = { bucket1 = { bucket = "my-random-bucket-1" } bucket2 = { bucket = "my-random-bucket-2" tags = { Secure = "probably" } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Terraform S3 Bucket Output Variables DESCRIPTION: Output variables exposed by the S3 bucket module including ARN, domain names, hosted zone ID, and website endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | s3_bucket_arn | The ARN of the bucket. Will be of format arn:aws:s3:::bucketname. | | s3_bucket_bucket_domain_name | The bucket domain name. Will be of format bucketname.s3.amazonaws.com. | | s3_bucket_bucket_regional_domain_name | The bucket region-specific domain name. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Input Variables for S3 Bucket Notifications DESCRIPTION: Declares input variables for configuring S3 bucket notifications, including bucket name, ARN, creation flags, and notification settings for Lambda, SNS, and SQS. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/modules/notification/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Name | Description | Type | Default | Required | |------|-------------|------|---------|:--------:| | [bucket](#input\_bucket) | Name of S3 bucket to use | `string` | `""` | no | | [bucket\_arn](#input\_bucket\_arn) | ARN of S3 bucket to use in policies | `string` | `null` | no | | [create](#input\_create) | Whether to create this resource or not? | `bool` | `true` | no | | [create\_lambda\_permission](#input\_create\_lambda\_permission) | Whether to create Lambda permissions or not? | `bool` | `true` | no | | [create\_sns\_policy](#input\_create\_sns\_policy) | Whether to create a policy for SNS permissions or not? | `bool` | `true` | no | | [create\_sqs\_policy](#input\_create\_sqs\_policy) | Whether to create a policy for SQS permissions or not? | `bool` | `true` | no | | [eventbridge](#input\_eventbridge) | Whether to enable Amazon EventBridge notifications | `bool` | `null` | no | | [lambda\_notifications](#input\_lambda\_notifications) | Map of S3 bucket notifications to Lambda function | `any` | `{}` | no | | [sns\_notifications](#input\_sns\_notifications) | Map of S3 bucket notifications to SNS topic | `any` | `{}` | no | | [sqs\_notifications](#input\_sqs\_notifications) | Map of S3 bucket notifications to SQS queue | `any` | `{}` | no | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Terraform Modules for S3 Bucket and KMS DESCRIPTION: Defines multiple Terraform modules including S3 buckets for inventory source, destination, and configurations. It also includes a KMS module for key management. These modules encapsulate reusable infrastructure components. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/s3-inventory/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` ## Modules | Name | Source | Version | |------|--------|---------| | [inventory\_destination\_bucket](#module\_inventory\_destination\_bucket) | ../../ | n/a | | [inventory\_source\_bucket](#module\_inventory\_source\_bucket) | ../../ | n/a | | [kms](#module\_kms) | terraform-aws-modules/kms/aws | ~> 2.0 | | [multi\_inventory\_configurations\_bucket](#module\_multi\_inventory\_configurations\_bucket) | ../../ | n/a | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing Terraform for S3 Account-Level Public Access Block Configuration DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize, plan, and apply the Terraform configuration for creating S3 account-level Public Access Block. Also includes a note about destroying resources to avoid unnecessary costs. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/account-public-access/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ terraform init $ terraform plan $ terraform apply ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Terraform Commands for S3 Directory Bucket Deployment DESCRIPTION: Basic Terraform workflow commands to initialize, plan, apply, and destroy the S3 directory bucket resources. This shows the standard Terraform workflow for deploying infrastructure. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/directory-bucket/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ terraform init $ terraform plan $ terraform apply ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing Terraform Commands for S3 Bucket Notifications DESCRIPTION: These commands initialize the Terraform working directory, create an execution plan, and apply the defined infrastructure changes for S3 bucket notifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/notification/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ terraform init $ terraform plan $ terraform apply ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining AWS S3 Account Public Access Block Resource in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the aws_s3_account_public_access_block resource in Terraform. It allows configuration of account-wide S3 public access settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/modules/account-public-access/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` resource "aws_s3_account_public_access_block" "this" {} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Terragrunt Configuration for S3 Bucket Wrapper Module DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure a Terragrunt file to use the S3 bucket wrapper module. It specifies the source module and provides input values including defaults and items representing multiple S3 buckets. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { # Default values create = true tags = { Terraform = "true" Environment = "dev" } } items = { my-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } my-second-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } # omitted... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Terragrunt for S3 Bucket Notification Module DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure Terragrunt to use the S3 bucket notification module wrapper. It sets up default values and defines multiple items to be managed. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/notification/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers/notification" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers/notification?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { # Default values create = true tags = { Terraform = "true" Environment = "dev" } } items = { my-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } my-second-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } # omitted... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Multiple S3 Buckets with Terragrunt DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to manage multiple S3 buckets in a single Terragrunt layer. It sets default values for all buckets and defines specific configurations for individual buckets. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/notification/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { force_destroy = true attach_elb_log_delivery_policy = true attach_lb_log_delivery_policy = true attach_deny_insecure_transport_policy = true attach_require_latest_tls_policy = true } items = { bucket1 = { bucket = "my-random-bucket-1" } bucket2 = { bucket = "my-random-bucket-2" tags = { Secure = "probably" } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Terragrunt for S3 Bucket Object Wrapper DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for using the S3 bucket object wrapper module with Terragrunt. Shows how to specify the source and define default values and multiple items. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/object/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers/object" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers/object?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { # Default values create = true tags = { Terraform = "true" Environment = "dev" } } items = { my-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } my-second-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } # omitted... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Terraform Configuration for S3 Bucket Wrapper Module DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the S3 bucket wrapper module directly in Terraform. It defines a module block with the appropriate source and input parameters for managing multiple buckets. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` module "wrapper" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers" defaults = { # Default values create = true tags = { Terraform = "true" Environment = "dev" } } items = { my-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } my-second-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } # omitted... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring S3 Bucket Module Wrapper with Terragrunt DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure the S3 bucket module wrapper using Terragrunt. It sets up default values and defines multiple items to be managed by the module. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/wrappers/account-public-access/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { source = "tfr:///terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws//wrappers/account-public-access" # Alternative source: # source = "git::git@github.com:terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket.git//wrappers/account-public-access?ref=master" } inputs = { defaults = { # Default values create = true tags = { Terraform = "true" Environment = "dev" } } items = { my-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } my-second-item = { # omitted... can be any argument supported by the module } # omitted... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining S3 Bucket Output Values DESCRIPTION: Specifies the output values for the S3 bucket configurations. These outputs provide important information about the created S3 buckets, including ARN, domain name, region, and website endpoints, which can be used for further configurations or integrations. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/s3-inventory/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` ## Outputs | Name | Description | |------|-------------| | [s3\_bucket\_arn](#output\_s3\_bucket\_arn) | The ARN of the bucket. Will be of format arn:aws:s3:::bucketname. | | [s3\_bucket\_bucket\_domain\_name](#output\_s3\_bucket\_bucket\_domain\_name) | The bucket domain name. Will be of format bucketname.s3.amazonaws.com. | | [s3\_bucket\_bucket\_regional\_domain\_name](#output\_s3\_bucket\_bucket\_regional\_domain\_name) | The bucket region-specific domain name. The bucket domain name including the region name, please refer here for format. Note: The AWS CloudFront allows specifying S3 region-specific endpoint when creating S3 origin, it will prevent redirect issues from CloudFront to S3 Origin URL. | | [s3\_bucket\_hosted\_zone\_id](#output\_s3\_bucket\_hosted\_zone\_id) | The Route 53 Hosted Zone ID for this bucket's region. | | [s3\_bucket\_id](#output\_s3\_bucket\_id) | The name of the bucket. | | [s3\_bucket\_region](#output\_s3\_bucket\_region) | The AWS region this bucket resides in. | | [s3\_bucket\_website\_domain](#output\_s3\_bucket\_website\_domain) | The domain of the website endpoint, if the bucket is configured with a website. If not, this will be an empty string. This is used to create Route 53 alias records. | | [s3\_bucket\_website\_endpoint](#output\_s3\_bucket\_website\_endpoint) | The website endpoint, if the bucket is configured with a website. If not, this will be an empty string. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Terraform and Provider Requirements DESCRIPTION: Specifies the required versions for Terraform, AWS provider, and Random provider. It ensures compatibility and sets minimum version constraints for the infrastructure deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/examples/s3-inventory/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` ## Requirements | Name | Version | |------|---------| | [terraform](#requirement\_terraform) | >= 1.0 | | [aws](#requirement\_aws) | >= 5.83 | | [random](#requirement\_random) | >= 2.0 | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Before Migration: S3 Bucket Configuration v2.x DESCRIPTION: Example configuration using version 2.x of the S3 bucket module with AWS provider below 3.75.0 SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` module "s3_bucket" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws" version = "~> 2.0" bucket = "my-awesome-bucket" acl = "log-delivery-write" } terraform { required_providers { aws = "~> 3.69.0" # or anything lower than 3.75.0 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: After Migration: S3 Bucket Configuration v3.x DESCRIPTION: Example configuration using version 3.x of the S3 bucket module with AWS provider 4.5.0 or higher SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` module "s3_bucket" { source = "terraform-aws-modules/s3-bucket/aws" version = "~> 3.0" bucket = "my-awesome-bucket" acl = "log-delivery-write" } terraform { required_providers { aws = ">= 4.5" # or anything higher than 4.5.0 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Terraform and AWS Provider Requirements DESCRIPTION: Specifies the required versions for Terraform and the AWS provider. Terraform version 1.0 or higher and AWS provider version 3.74 or higher are required. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/modules/notification/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` terraform { required_version = ">= 1.0" } provider "aws" { version = ">= 3.74" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Terragrunt with S3 Bucket Module in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the S3 bucket module with Terragrunt, addressing the issue with variables of type 'any'. It shows how to properly encode input variables using jsonencode() for Terragrunt compatibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` inputs = { bucket = "foobar" # `bucket` has type `string`, no need to jsonencode() cors_rule = jsonencode([...]) # `cors_rule` has type `any`, so `jsonencode()` is required } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS S3 Resources Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing all AWS S3 bucket related resources managed by this Terraform module, including bucket configurations, policies, and settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Name | Type | |------|------| | [aws_s3_bucket.this](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/s3_bucket) | resource | | [aws_s3_bucket_accelerate_configuration.this](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/s3_bucket_accelerate_configuration) | resource | | [aws_s3_bucket_acl.this](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/s3_bucket_acl) | resource | | [aws_s3_bucket_analytics_configuration.this](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/s3_bucket_analytics_configuration) | resource | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS IAM and Additional Resources Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing AWS IAM policy documents and other data sources used by the S3 bucket module for access control and configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/terraform-aws-modules/terraform-aws-s3-bucket/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | [aws_iam_policy_document.access_log_delivery](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/data-sources/iam_policy_document) | data source | | [aws_iam_policy_document.combined](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/data-sources/iam_policy_document) | data source | | [aws_iam_policy_document.deny_incorrect_encryption_headers](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/data-sources/iam_policy_document) | data source | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring AWS Resources for S3 Bucket Notifications DESCRIPTION: Lists the AWS resources used in this module, including Lambda permissions, S3 bucket notifications, SNS topic policies, and SQS queue policies.
